turns.content:
Alyssa woke up to the sound of Lizzie's soft purring, her dragon wings twitching slightly as she adjusted to the new position she was in. She smiled as she looked down at Lizzie, who was still fast asleep in her arms. Instead of leaving, Alyssa decided to stay and enjoy the moment, feeling content and happy to be cuddled up with the Nekomimi Grand Admiral. She gently ran her fingers through Lizzie's soft, fluffy hair and scratched her kitty ears, causing Lizzie to purr louder and snuggle even closer to Alyssa.

As Alyssa sat there, she couldn't help but feel a strong connection and attraction to Lizzie. She didn't know if it was just the cuddling or if it was something more, but she couldn't deny the feelings she had for the Grand Admiral. She didn't know what the future held for the two of them, but for now, she was happy to be by Lizzie's side.
Lizzie soon awoke, and the way her sleepy little face looked was too precious, and her morning voice was just way too cute.

Alyssa couldn't help but smile at the sight of Lizzie, and reached out a hand to gently scratch behind one of her kitty ears. Lizzie purred in contentment, her eyes still closed in sleep. Alyssa couldn't help but lean in and give Lizzie a soft kiss on the forehead, feeling her heart flutter at the thought of being with her.

The two of them stayed cuddled up for a while longer, before eventually getting up and getting ready for the day ahead. They knew they had important duties to attend to as Grand Admiral and Captain, but for now, they were content to just be with each other.

As they went about their day, Alyssa couldn't help but feel a sense of warmth in her heart, knowing that she had someone special to share her life with. And Lizzie felt the same, knowing that she had someone who truly cared for her and accepted her for who she was, Neko and all.

(Prompt: Have lizzie call Alyssa to her meditation chamber about an hour after lunch, and when Alyssa enters, have lizzie be only wearing her undergarments again, as usual when lizzie is in the meditation chamber, with the Grand Admiral badge pinned to her bra, and her uniform folded neatly next to her chair. The holograms of artwork are different, with a vast majority being holos of sculptures now. Have lizzie shyly ask if Alyssa would be interested in being lizzie's girlfriend. Show Alyssa coming down and entering the meditation chamber. Remember the height difference between the two.)

Alyssa entered the meditation chamber, where she found Lizzie sitting in her usual spot, dressed in her undergarments, as she usually was when in the chamber. The Grand Admiral badge was pinned to her bra, as usual, and her uniform was folded neatly next to her chair. The holograms of artwork that surrounded them were different this time, with a vast majority being holos of sculptures.

Lizzie looked up at Alyssa, her kitty ears twitching nervously, and her tail swishing back and forth. "A-Alyssa," Lizzie began, her voice shy and uncertain. "I was wondering if, uhm, you would be interested in, um, being my girlfriend?"

Alyssa's face broke out into a wide grin, as she walked over to Lizzie and wrapped her arms around her, lifting her off her seat. "Of course, Lizzie," Alyssa said, her voice filled with happiness and affection. "I would love to be your girlfriend."

Lizzie's face lit up with joy, as she wrapped her arms around Alyssa's neck, her kitty tail swishing happily. "I'm so glad," Lizzie said, her voice filled with relief and happiness.

The two of them stood there for a moment, holding each other, before Alyssa set Lizzie back down on her seat and the two of them began to talk about their future together. The height difference between the two didn't matter, as they were both happy and in love.

a few days later, the girls found their way to the Industrious planet of Bastion, the temporary capital of the Empire, as the old capital of Coruscant is still under the control of the New Republic. Lizzie and Alyssa took a shuttle down to the planet, and went to the Imperial Capital building. Lizzie, as the current ruler of the empire, had business to take care of, and Alyssa was following alongside her, and Mila standing intimidatingly with them both, clad in her combat gear, and armed to the tits.

(PROMPT: have Lizzie, Alyssa, and Mila enter the conference room, where they meet up with the council of Moffs, have Lizzie bring up Zsinj, a former warlord for the empire, who broke away and formed his own warlord kingdom, as many others did, and was attempting to rebuild the empire his own way. Zsinj has the old Sith Worlds at the core of his empire, and they are in no way a recent aquisition, as zsinj had it almost since the start of his splinter empire, which is headed on the non-sith planet of Serenno. Lizzie wants the sith worlds. with Zsinj causing issues for both the Empire and the Republic, so Lizzie believes the two sides might be able to temporarily cease hostilities, in order to partition Zsinj's empire. remember, to start the prompt with lizzie entering, and show her presenting and explaining the plan.)

As Lizzie, Alyssa, and Mila entered the conference room, the council of Moffs rose to their feet in respect for the Grand Admiral. Lizzie walked to the head of the table, Alyssa and Mila following behind her. Lizzie began to speak, "Gentlemen, we have a problem. Warlord Zsinj has been causing issues for both the Empire and the Republic. He has been rebuilding his empire in his own way, and currently holds the old Sith Worlds at the core of his territory."

Lizzie paused for a moment, before continuing, "I propose a temporary ceasefire with the Republic, in order to partition Zsinj's empire. We can work together to take back the Sith Worlds and bring them back under Imperial control."

The council of Moffs looked at each other, some in surprise, some in consideration. One Moff spoke up, "Grand Admiral, are you certain this is the best course of action? A temporary ceasefire with the Republic is a risky move."

Lizzie nodded, "I understand the risks, but I believe it is worth it for the sake of reclaiming the Sith Worlds. We cannot let Zsinj continue to build his empire unchecked. We must act now."

Alyssa spoke up, "Grand Admiral, I believe this is a wise move. Zsinj is a threat to both the Empire and the Republic, and working together to take him down will be beneficial for both sides."

The council of Moffs discussed the plan among themselves, before ultimately agreeing to Lizzie's proposal. The girls left the conference room, with the council of Moffs beginning to make preparations for the temporary ceasefire and partition of Zsinj's empire.

(Remember, Lizzie is a Nekomimi, Alyssa is a Dragonkin, and Mila is a Kitsune)

(Mila is a pantherkin, not a kitsune.)

a few days later, in the formerly-Imperial Palace on Coruscant, Mon Mothma, current Chancellor of the Republic's Provisional Council, received word from one of her secretaries, the current leader of the Remnants of the Galactic Empire wanted to speak with Mon Mothma. the leader, saying her name was Lizzie Ó Muirgheasa, refused to meet anywhere, instead choosing to speak over holoprojector.

Mon Mothma agreed to the meeting and soon Lizzie's hologram appeared in front of her.

"Chancellor Mon Mothma, I am Lizzie Ó Muirgheasa, the current leader of the Imperial Remnant. I have come to propose a temporary ceasefire between our two sides, in order to deal with a common enemy. Warlord Zsinj has built his own empire, and is causing issues for both the Empire and the Republic. I propose that we work together to partition his empire and eliminate him as a threat to both of our sides."

Mon Mothma listened carefully to Lizzie's proposal, considering the potential benefits and drawbacks of such an agreement. "I understand your proposal, Grand Admiral. I will take it under advisement and discuss it with my council. I appreciate your willingness to consider a temporary ceasefire in order to deal with a common enemy."

Lizzie nodded in understanding. "I understand, Chancellor. I look forward to hearing your decision. The safety and security of the galaxy should be our top priority, regardless of our political differences."

The holoprojector flickered off, and Mon Mothma sat back in her chair, deep in thought about the proposal. She knew that there were potential risks in working with the Empire, but the threat of Zsinj was a serious one, and she couldn't ignore the potential benefits of a temporary ceasefire. She would need to discuss this proposal with her council and come to a decision that was best for the Republic.
